div.p: seek out the Grand Chefre & bring Jollibois to the Fort[.] They are also to bring provisions during the Summer[.]

Friday 4th[.] Beaulieu with two of the young men brought 4 Cranes 1 Small Br & 5 Ducks[.] [T]he young men complained that Beaulieu had fired a great deal of their Amn Sans desein[.] The little Rascal got a good Sett down & was near getting his Ears pinched[.] As I find that none of Mr Keiths men appear & being myself in a very critical situation for want of Provns I prepared Genereux, Rangé & Beaulieu to be off tomorrow for Bear Lake[.] Gave them 28lb fat & Dried meat, 12 Lb lb Mt & 8lb Grease, lent them an old Gun & 5 meas: Amn[.]

Satury 5th[.] At Sun rise Sent off the men mentioned as above to Bear Lake in a Saulteux Canoe[.] Two hours after arrived Dzoneebettau again wt 7 men & Boys[.] [R]ecieved from these 64 Skins of furrs for their debts & Traded 18 Skins more[.] Gave out Credits again & Sent them off[.] In the afternoon the Slave Hunter returned from his chase – brought 2 Swans 2 Ducks & 4 Loons[.] [H]e missed at a moose & wounded a Bear but could not pursue him on account of his having no shoes[.] 5 Ps of Fish in the nets[.]

Sunday 6th[.] In the afternoon arrived Smith with 3 Cadnadians in two Large Canoes laden with 55 Packs & a remainder of furrs from Mr Keith, this being returns of that Quarter, together with 8 Ps of Grease, 6 Bales of Dried meat, & 2 bags of Lb Ditto besides 1 Keg Gum & 20 fms of Canoe Bark for Br Lake exclusive of 2 Pactins of Dressed Orignal Skins & Bark for 2 more Canoes for this Place[.] This is the 3rd Day they Mr Keith who writes word, that the non arrival of the Indians & the Trouble there was of finding Canoe Bark occasioned this long delay[.] [V]ery fine weather[.]
